name: places/ChIJ7eg7WJ33wokRM8mtMBqVAY8
formattedAddress: 31 W 115th St, New York, NY 10026, USA
adrFormatAddress: 31 W 115th St, New York, NY 10026, USA

originalText.text:
the worst experience I have ever had. I paid for two hours of parking online. I checked my car in I was asked by the manger how long I would be staying I stated I paid for two hours of parking. I left I came back 20 mins early to get my car I handed him my ticket
(already paid for) this man is going to ring me up for 10 dollars. I stated I already paid online and there is nothing in writing stating I would be charged further for anything else. He told me if I don't pay he would not give me my car. I asked him for his bosses number and the customer service number because I'm not paying for anything else as I prepaid. I went and looked through there online policy. no where on that policy does it state after you pay online they can charge a random fee that the manager has made up in his head. This mans name is Edwin Rosario he has no customer service training has an attitude from the beginning of the transaction till the end. i was told to google the customer service number in which I did I spoke to the service rep who told him that he had to call his boss in order to conclude the transaction his boss told him to release my car back to me. I have never experienced such a miserable soul judging from the 10 reviews already listed Edwin needs to be removed from duty immediately.

originalText.text: The manager of this location was the one that took my car when I arrived on a Sunday. I came back Wednesday morning and this guy tries to tell me I wasn’t supposed to be back until Thursday. He misunderstood when I dropped off I guess because he started getting really loud and arguing with me over what day I said I was picking up because they had to move cars. I stood there for a while which I expected and he shouted about it the entire time. Not only was it rude, it was pointless because they had to get my car either way and he was arguing with me over the day he misunderstood. Kind of hilarious but yeah, there are way too many lots in the city to be worried about one that’s run by a guy like that.

Kind of hilarious but yeah, there are way too many lots in the city to be worried about one that’s run by a guy like that.

originalText.text: Horrible experience, attendant got upset that I drove a little past the sign which I didn’t see nor do intentionally. Even after I backed up was still complaining and then they proceeded to start driving my car off when I was still grabbing my things out of the vehicle. Asking if I’m done yet while I was in the trunk, so clearly not. When I asked for one minute please, he replied “maybe if I stopped at the right spot, I have cars to move”. There wasn’t any cars behind me and I already had backed up to where to asked. Even when I went back to pick up the car, I was going to leave it alone but they guy inside the booth asked “if I’m okay now?” Talking about they had a crazy morning, I don’t understand, it is a big deal. These are not my issues I expect to be treated fairly and greeted with common courtesy when I arrive somewhere I am giving my business too. I literally would have left in the AM if I didn’t pre-pay already and also did not want to be bothered  upon picking up. I usually never go out my way to complain but I’m genuinely frustrated about this situation. Someone in customer service should not be upset about having to do their job and know how to deal with people regardless of how their day is going.

originalText.text: Horrible, worst experience I have ever had in a parking garage. When I drove in the morning, attendant was very rude and mad that i drove in the garage. It's as if he was upset that he had to do his job.  When I came to pick up my car 12 hours later, the second attendant was also rude and didn't acknowledge my presence at all. Never again!!!!

It's as if he was upset that he had to do his job.  When I came to pick up my car 12 hours later, the second attendant was also rude and didn't acknowledge my presence at all. Never again!!!!

originalText.text: Probably the worst parking spot in NYC. The manager Edwin is rude, dismissive and condescending. Just know parking fee will be the least of your concern. The manager Edwin and his employee will damage you car and not own up to it. His answers is “well too bad”. Be ready to sue when you park here.
